description:
Update! Our wedding reception could not have been more perfect. Everyone *raved* about the food and atmosphere and Paula and Shannon were absolute angels. I can't say enough good things. 

Sip Tea is an absolute treasure across from Golden Gate Park. It's a perfectly charming tea party experience with delicious tea sandwiches, scones to die for, and amazing bite size cheesecake. Shannon is so accommodating and the whole staff is super friendly. 

They also offer a delightful space for special occasions and we are doing our wedding reception here.
author: Selena L.

description:
Cute ambiance and friendly service. Good for those once in a while catch up with friends and family. Price is ok for San francisco, but overpriced overall. Had the "Tea for two" and split amongst three people. Bill came out to roughly $25 per person.

Food: Had the Afternoon tea for two which comes with 2 scones, tea, 2 sandwiches and an assortment of desserts. 

Recommend: Assam Chai Black tea. No afternoon tea is complete without having black tea with a little bit of milk. Fragrant smell. 

Skip: I also tried the "Mao Feng Shui" tea which has a "vegetarian grass" taste. It's a green tea, which I usually like but I found the grass taste a bit overwhelming. 

Sandwiches:I would recommend getting the cream cheese with salmon, and ham with mustard. Their sandwiches weren't anything out of the ordinary, but they tasted fine. 

Scones: Their scones taste ok. Nothing too  impressive. Definitely liked their sandwichs  more. They also provide some jam and cream to put on the scones.

Overall, I would recommend this place b/c it is fairly inexpensive, especially for San Francisco prices. However, the food itself was mediocre.
author: Vivian L.

description:
It was my first time at Sip. Parking was a bit terrible but I loved the overall cozy, nook-like cafe it was in. 

My boyfriend and I loved the colorful decor, menu, and the overall experience! We ordered the 3-tier afternoon tea set which came with 4 different kinds of mini sandwiches, two scones with spread, and some lovely little desserts on top! 

The meal was quite filling, even for a couple of stoners. 

We will definitely be back again!
author: Kaileigh O.

description:
This is a nice find, I am a secret tea admirer. They have a great menu selection from a single tea sandwich a pot of tea, or a complete high tea with sandwiches and dessert appetizers to make a whole group happy and delighted. I had the egg salad and chicken curry tea sandwiches and they both had great flavor and the tomato basil soup was the warm creamy finish to a quick snack. 
Great job sip. Parking is difficult so plan on parking at Golden gate parka and walking 2-3 blocks. I just changed the review to 5 stars, because the butter and roll served with the food was amazing to my taste buds. Quick tip don't go gluten free, but I bet they may have the option if you ask, go for the butter and roll, you will be pleasantly surprised I think.
author: Timothy P.

description:
Given the change of ownership at Lovejoy's Tearoom, which used to be one of our favorites, we thought we'd give Sip a try, seeing the Yelp ratings.  I'm glad we tried it, but before we return, I think we'll opt for other places instead.

The food was fine, and apparently, everything is made on the premises.  We got the $27.00 3-tierd set up, and shared it, along with the $5.00 small pot of tea.  It was well priced.  If we were really hungry, there was a $52.00 (if I recall correctly) option for two, which would've been too much for us, since they're fairly heavy on desserts. 

What we didn't care much for was the loud music in the background.  I guess that just didn't match our expectations of a nice quiet, relaxing tea room experience.  It's located in a pretty lively busy neighborhood, so I guess that's the buzz they're going for inside too. The thought crossed my mind of asking them to lower the volume of the music, but if that's the vibe they're seeking, who am I to change it?  After 10 minutes or so, I didn't notice it as much, but we prefer a much more "sedate" environment when it comes to afternoon tea.  The Sheraton Palace is next on our list of tea rooms to try.  I'm hopeful that'll be a more quiet experience.  I've just never been anywhere for tea where the music feels like I'm kind of in a hip bar.  

If you're going on a weekend, as we did, just be prepared to encounter difficult parking.  I know that isn't as aspect of the restaurant itself, but it is a part of your experience, if that's your destination.  We came yesterday for a 1pm reservation on a sunny Sunday, and there was a flea market on Irving, along with a packed Golden Gate Park.  My husband dropped me off, as he went in search of a parking spot, and called me a couple of times, saying he was about to give up.  Not a nice way to start of our tea.  Fair warning on the parking. 

Service was initially fine with our waiter, but no one ever came to see if we wanted more tea.  I had to flag down someone, who I believe was the owner, to ask her for a hot water refill on our tea.  She was going through the restaurant handing out the checks, but didn't seem to have time to also look around to see if anyone needed anything else.  Typically, you'll find service a little over attentive in a tea room, but that won't be something you'll experience here.  

A little disappointing for us, given some of the positive Yelp reviews.  I think I'll pass on a repeat visit for awhile, given the numerous options for tea in the Bay Area.
author: Lori N.

description:
Lovely!  Came for tea around tea time on a Sunday (the weekend of outside lands, actually).  The place was actually pretty quiet.  I had called about 30 minutes ahead just to make sure they could take me and honestly, I probably could have just walked in.

I ordered the high tea to get the full experience.  Everything is made in house.  The strawberry marmalade has got to be the highlight of everything.  It tasted so fresh and naturally sweet.  You can taste the love.  

The staff are really sweet.  I probably sat for 2 hours and they didn't rush me at all.  While I was there, a table had forgotten their boxed food and the server ran down the street to try to find them.  At some point, a piano player played 2 songs.  

If you want tea in SF without all the hustle and bustle, this is the place.  Will definitely be back (when the weather is better in the sunset).
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Sip Tea Room is absolutely lovely! The place itself is small, but cozy with it's dainty decor, pastels, and a typical cute teatime set-up. Loved the large chalk board with some of their items and how the doors were open; very welcoming and offered a nice afternoon breeze.  

We loved the Afternoon Tea for Two: four sandwiches, coleslaw, two scones with spreads, variety of dessert, and a pot of tea of your choice. We also ordered sausage rolls and a cup of soup. Everything was delicious and the food was fresh, but I really recommend the sausage rolls! They have a good selection of sandwiches and teas to choose from to suit your tastes. 

However the best part would be the excellent service. You definitely feel very accommodated and I enjoyed how we were constantly checked up on and asked if we needed anything. There wasn't a wait for anything either. My family had such a great time here and I can't wait to come back whenever I'm in San Francisco!
author: Olyvia Y.

description:
I think I have been to almost every high tea place in the city and Sip Tea Room is by far my favorite. They really really did a good job making the dreary secret garden (old tea place) into a bright and airy tea room. The place was super cute and for the royal wedding they had trivia at the table! The food was really good. We got the smoked salmon, egg salad, cheddar and apple, and curried chicken. My bf liked the smoked salmon and egg salad best. I liked the cheddar apple and curried chicken. That is how you know the sandwiches are good! In addition the scones were tasty and the numerous desserts were generous (raspberry cake, Burberry cheesecake, and brownie.) My bf really liked the dessert because he felt it was not overly sweet.

All in all, there was so much food my bf said he felt the food coma coming on! What was even better was that the price for high tea was very reasonable given the amount of food and the quality. This place is definitely a better value than the rotunda, Fairmont, lovejoy and crown and crumpet (similar value as dartealing lounge but I think this place is better tasting and has a better atmosphere.) I would highly recommend this place!
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
Visiting from out of town and searching for a cute tea room. Passed this place in an Uber yesterday and decided to come back today. Could not have been more pleased with Sip! 

Atmosphere: Easy to find. Very cute and cozy, with just the right amount of charm but not too kitchy. Pretty new to the city, as it's only been there for 6 months. Good size and the smell of freshly baked goods wafted throughout the entire restaurant. 

Service: I called about 30 minutes before we got there and was relieved that I didn't need to make a reservation a week advance. We were greeted and seated instantly at a cute table for two next to the window. Adorable place settings made it feel like I was in a traditional English tea house. Everyone who worked here was very friendly and attentive. Brought us more clotted cream and lemon curd when we asked for it. 

Food: Loved the different options of food and tea mixings they offered on the menu. My boyfriend and I decided on the afternoon tea for two, which came with four sandwiches, 2 scones, desserts, and a large pot of tea. The current scone with clotted cream and lemon curd was my favorite, because it was warm and went perfectly with my Earl Grey tea. Sandwiches weren't amazing, but I appreciated the wide variety of offerings. $51 seemed pretty reasonable to me for as much food and tea as came with the tea for two. Much better and cuter than high tea offered in many chic hotels. 

I was pleasantly surprised with Sip and would recommend it to anyone looking for a cute place for afternoon tea in the city! Definitely will come back next time I'm in the area.
author: Katie R.

description:
Not impressed. I really wanted to like this spot, decor and atmosphere are super cute, there's so much potential to be better but food/sandwiches/desserts - tasteless and stale. Unless food quality gets better, I will not recommend this cute spot.

**Reply to Sip T. comment: 
I'm sorry my review wasn't to your liking but I don't need to be schooled on how to leave reviews. I am not obligated to put my full name or a photo (which still wouldn't prove anything), this isn't required. As I am not obligated to address your staff of stale desserts. I paid pretty price$ for tiny 3 pieces. Yelp is for providing others with my personal experience and my opinion of your business. You don't have to agree or like it, otherwise everyone would have five stars. Also, you might want to rethink huge forks and knives for such delicate surroundings. Those would be great for steaks. Again, just my personal suggestion but you can continue serving stale food.
author: Natalie G.

description:
A fellow yelp friend and I met up for tea at this lovely place. This place apparently gets filled up quickly, so it's best to make reservations. We made reservations in the early afternoon and got seated pretty quickly. The space is smaller so I can see why it fills up quickly. Our lovely server is from Scotland, and she was able to explain the menu thoroughly to us. We both got the Sip Tea Classic. It comes with your choice of tea, and a scone and tea sandwiches. 

There are a great number of tea sandwiches to choose from, and I chose the Branston Pickle, Aged White Cheddar & Green Apple sandwich, and the Sip's Curried Chicken, along with the orange cranberry scone. The tea sandwiches were cut into 3 thin slices and were both very delicious! I would def get both again. The scone was also quite yummy, and it had cream, strawberry preserves, and lemon curds to pair it with. 

There is also a number of tea selections, and I got the china rose petal. The china is so beautiful and the tea was a nice soft taste. 

Service is wonderful, and the ambiance is adorable. If you want a fun English tea experience please come here. Will def be bringing friends here again :)
author: Jackie C.

description:
Quick Summary:
- Enter starving, you will be full
- Easy walking distance from MUNI
- Reservation is best, but we walked in the time before the reservation times start, so we were able to claim a seat. If not lucky, one might wait for quite some time until the tables are open.
- Generous waiters and waitresses and helped us on how to eat them.

We ordered the Tea for Three (there were three of us)
Sandwiches: smoked salmon, egg salad, cheddar and apple, curry chicken, goat cheese and herb, ham.
Scones: Currant and lemon poppyseed (scones of the day)
Cakes: (cakes of the day) 
Tea: Earl Gray and Honeybush

A taste of London's afternoon tea in San Francisco. I have a relative who has been to London before, and she said it was just like it - but more portions xD

What I felt was extremely kind and generous of the cafe was when we ordered. When we ordered one traditional and one tea for two, the waitress responded, "Ah, tea for three?" So, she combined our orders! I was very moved because there was a similar afternoon tea cafe in SF that would not let us eat three people with a "tea for two" and demanded the third person to order another. (We ended up leaving that cafe before ordering).
After we ordered and the famous 'three-tier" plates arrived, all of our sandwiches, scones, and desserts were placed neatly and so beautifully. We got a sandwich each for the flavors we ordered, so it was very fun to enjoy all of them. 

We ate from the bottom up: sandwiches, scones, and then the cakes. We ate at our usual pace, and we stayed for over an hour. Also, we were growing full after eating scones, so the snacks pack volume despite the looks.
author: Mito I.

description: I wanted to like Sip, and I want to give them a good review because I liked the people that worked there. But I couldn't get over the smell of the restaurant, I was sitting outside and could still smell it wafting out the door: like something was rotting? And the food was overpriced. I wouldn't go back, but I really enjoyed the workers so this isn't an ode to them.
author: Sydney G.

description:
Such an upgrade after the previous Tea room! Really feels like you're in Merry old England having a tea party. The wait staff are delightful and the teas are divine. Highly suggest waiting for a table outside when it's nice out. You'll get compliments on your table from strangers walking by!

Try the sausage rolls and Tea sandwiches. I wouldn't suggest the Ploughman's lunch. It's probably a good representation of English brunch but I just don't get deli meats for lunch ‍
author: Dyanna Q.

description: Best Tea Room in San Francisco! My mom, our long time family friend, and I came here with an 11 am reservation on a Saturday morning and had a magnificent time. Paula (owner) and Suzie (long time employee) gave us a delightful experience with incredible home made food (down to the crust!) and scrumptious teas. I wasn't a "tea person" until I came here--now I have it every morning and evening! We had the and the Traditional English Breakfast cart with the Scottish Breakfast Tea (pictured). We also had the Quiche and Sausage Roll Bites--exquisite! Overall we will most definitely come back again and highly recommend for any party, gathering, afternoon tea, and children!
author: Laura K.

description:
I have a deep love for afternoon tea and have been wanting to trying this place ever since passing by it several months ago and peeking in to admire its pretty interior. I finally met up with a friend here on a bright and chilly day for a reservation at 1. We marveled at the charm of the warm and intimate room and enjoyed ourselves for 2 hours or so.

We both ordered the Sip Tea Classic option of two tea sandwiches and one scone. Our seasonal Cranberry Orange scone was served with strawberry preserves, clotted cream, and lemon curd. Written on the blackboard are amusing instructions on how to eat a scone. A waitress told us that she favored the Cornwall Style and so we went with her suggestion. All the spreads were so yummy on the scone. 

I chose the Branston Pickle, Aged White Cheddar & Green Apple (recommended by our waitress) and the Smoked Salmon & Sip Cream Cheese sandwiches. The Branston Pickle sandwich was especially tasty. The tangy chutney goes heavenly with the crisp, tart apple and rich, creamy white cheddar. The Smoked Salmon had very thinly sliced salmon which made me regret not getting the Curried Chicken. 

For the tea, I had the caffeine free HoneyBush. The tea had a mild honey flavor and lovely pink hue. I think I would have preferred a stronger brew. Our waitress said the cups she gave us were new. It felt special being a first time user. The china was so pretty and delicate. Even the tea strainer and holder was delightful. 

Although the portions were a bit small, the food was delicious. For afternoon tea, the price is affordable. The service was friendly and the atmosphere was pleasant. I'm sure I will find my way back here again.
author: Lauren H.

description:
My friends and I visited this super cute new tearoom a few months back. I called in advance to make a reservation and was excited to try it out since the price is right.

Most of us got the Traditional English Afternoon Tea although one of my friends got the Sip Classic Tea. The Sip Classic Tea seems to be a better value than the Traditional English Afternoon Tea. The difference is basically sweets (which we don't like that much in general) and coleslaw. 

Since I was in a group, we shared several pots of tea, including Scottish Breakfast, Earl Grey, and Darjeeling. It was a lovely way to spend the afternoon. There are many tea options in SF but most of them are incredibly overpriced. Out of the reasonably priced options, I would still rank Lovejoy's #1 but Sip is a close second place and it's easier to get into.
author: Yi Z.

description:
This is a cute little tea room located right across from one of the entrances of Golden Gate Park. As such, good luck finding parking on weekends, and maybe even on Fridays! The interior design is cute and cozy, though it does get quite loud when there is a full house!

My friend and I visited on a Friday afternoon, ordering up their tea for 2. Portion size is very generous! The food is delicious and so is their tea. My favorites were definitely the salmon sandwich and the scones!

Food is deserving of 4 stars, but I docked a star due to service. My friend and I awkwardly stood at the entrance for a good 5 minutes, just waiting to be seated. They were definitely not busy at the hour we went. Also, it took quite awhile to flag anyone down for the check as well; all heads were down! It may have just been an off day, so I'll give them another shot when I'm in the Sunset and in the market for afternoon tea!
author: Kristi T.

description:
I am not a "tea-time" type of person. However, I have been to many places throughout California for high tea because it's one my wife's favorite things to do in the world. Sip has been among the top in terms of food, ambience and service. 

The highlight for me was the food and service. We ordered the Tea for Two for just under $50. If this sounds like a lot, it's completely reasonable. I have been to fancy hotels for afternoon tea and paid much more for much less. This included scones, 4 varieties of sandwiches, a large pot of tea and an assortment of desserts. They were happy to let us substitute a little in the sandwiches. We added cucumber to the goat cheese and herb sandwich, which was fantastic. I also got a french press coffee. I don't drink a lot of tea.

They say that everything is handmade, and it tastes that way. You can sometimes hear the kitchen in the back running blenders to make clotted cream or smell fresh scones being baked. The sandwiches were all tasty. Great flavors, fresh ingredients. There was a real attention to detail here. 

The service was outstanding. We absolutely enjoyed talking with our waiter. We had a 3pm reservation and we were sat immediately. We stayed till they closed at 5pm and not once were we pressured to get up, or move on or do anything but enjoy our stay. We met several of the other wait staff as well, who were all equally kind. The interior was very nice. My wife could say much more. She loved every detail, and again the attention to detail was fantastic. 

We will be back. Probably soon. They are planning on opening in the evenings soon and having live music and drinks. This sounds like it would be fun as well.
author: John W.

description:
I LOVE to sip tea! The dainty sandwiches and sweets, the fragile tea sets, the hot tea that warms your soul. It all makes you feel so...fancy, which I normally am not. But it's the best kind of thing to do in the fall with your girl friends.

I'm not a huge fan of the location, but parking was a snap on a Friday afternoon! The decorations were so cute and I just loved the atmosphere. We were one of the three tables and the service was great. Also, if you're someone who doesn't like attention, maybe don't wear heels. The tapping of your heels on the hardwood (?) floors will disturb the quietness in the open room.

I'd recommend the Tea for Two, Traditional English Afternoon Tea - it's their most expensive tea service. It's $50 and it may not look like a lot of food. But it definitely filled us up. You get to choose your fresh pot of tea, 4 types of sandwiches, and 2 scones.

We ordered the Honeybush and it's become my new favorite tea. Fruity and sweet. Even with just a little bit of sugar, it was enough.

For the sandwiches, we chose "Baked Ham, English Mustard & Tarragon Butter", "Egg Salad with Arugula", "Sip's Curried Chicken", and "Smoked Salmon and Sip Cream Cheese". My favorites were the Baked Ham and Smoked Salmon sandwiches. The Curried Chicken was good too! Didn't try the Egg Salad though - not a fan of egg salad. We had NO idea we'd be receiving 4 sets of 3 sandwiches! The Curried Chicken was more like a mini slider though so you only get 2.

They offered 1 Lemon scone and 1 Blueberry scone. My friend and I both preferred the Blueberry scone over the Lemon scone. The Lemon scone didn't have too much of a lemony flavor. But the lemon curd was amazing!

Lastly, they gave us an assorted selection of tiny cakes - cheesecake, lemon square, and a chocolate cake with a nutty "crust"? The cheesecake was the best one in my opinion. The lemon square kinda fell apart. And the chocolate cake was way too sweet. And I'm not a fan of nuts, in general.

I definitely want to come back and try other things - Sausage Rolls, Quiche, soup of the day, etc.
author: Athena C.

description:
My friends and I went to Sip Tea Room and had a delightful time.  There were a variety of teas, scones and sandwich options to choose from. I cannot eat gluten and considered not coming because I would not be able to enjoy the full experience of tea and scones.  But, went anyway. While,  it wasn't on the online menu, the tea room baked some gluten free scones and offered me gluten free crackers instead of bread so that I could partake in having sandwich bites as well. I can't speak enough as to how attentive the server was towards us.  Particularly enjoyed the strawberry jam and butter, the scones and the rose infused tea!  

There is a good vibe and music in the backroad.
A nearby child was celebrating her birthday and one of the staff played the birthday song on the organ. 

I highly recommend Sip Tea Room and we plan to make a regular afternoon tea event with the girls.
author: Tess G.

description:
Date & Time:  Saturday September 2, 2017 @ 2pm
Dining Companions:  The Husband & Doggie
Scene:  Ladies in Floral & Blush Summer Dresses or Crop Tops w/ Shortie Shorts & Strappy Flat Sandals
Decor:  Lovely Tea Room:  ChalkBoard Menus, White Tables w/ Grey Cushions & Sunny Yellow Walls
Service:  Sweetest & Most Charming Ladies
Imbibe:  Tea
Devour:  Afternoon Tea
Total:  $41.18
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Tried Sip Tea Room today for the first time today and it was really cute! Got the tea for two for $51, so not too bad of a deal compared to some other high tea places. It came with four finger sandwiches (two for each of us in groups of 3), two scones (each a different flavor) with clotted cream, lemon curd and strawberry jam, and four different desserts which we shared. There was a cheesecake with blueberry sauce on top, a rich chocolate cheesecake (maybe?), an almond cake, a berry crumble type of cake and a little saucer with strawberries and grapes. Everything was fresh and you can tell they make it there which is nice. And the ladies who were running it were really sweet, I think they might be sisters. They had a British accent too so it really seemed like the real deal haha. We got a pot of tea to share and chose the hibiscus, which was delightfully floral and had a lovely aroma as well. The interior was bright and cheery, and the tea pots and cups and saucers were really cute too! Wish we each got our own tea just because I like to try other flavors and maybe a couple of scones since I love scones so much (LOL), but not a huge deal! Overall a delightful experience. And it's right across from golden gate park too so perfect if you want to stroll around and walk off all of the food afterwards. :)
author: Carlie C.

description:
From the time you enter, Sip makes it clear that everything is made in house. There's no speculating that the cookies are from Costco like at another unnamed other Bay Area tea place. And accordingly, the food at Sip is excellent. My only (very small) quibbles are that I prefer a slightly sweeter scone and I'd like a savory in there (a puff? a tart?) that's not a sandwich. That's just my Sip constructive criticism.

Sip has gone modern and more streamlined in its ambiance. It's fine but needs a little something. Maybe take some inspiration from Crown and Crumpet or Satori? They also went modern but sort of "clever modern" with cute references to tea culture without the doilies and clutter. Sip is really loud and needs something to absorb the sound.

For the actual tea I went with chai which was a mistake on my part because I didn't realize that what I actually like is a chai latte. The chai was fine but advertised as spicy so I expected spicy which it wasn't. I actually preferred my bagged Trader Joe's chai at home. Sip's chai was on the bland side and not as aromatic.

We got the high tea for two. Note that it's for one pot. Serving it this way for two is a great money saving idea for some twosomes. My husband and my taste in tea is too divergent so we sprang for an extra pot. The run down on the sandos: The chicken curry sandwich was EXCELLENT. One of our sandwiches strangely had quadruple the amount of currants as the others. The smoked salmon and cream cheese was also really good. The egg salad with arugula was good but not as special. The husband thought the sandos were on the small side. (He actually had a slice of pizza immediately after tea, whereas I was stuffed.)

For the scones, the currant was good. I actually didn't taste the lemon in the lemon poppyseed. They came with lemon curd, homemade preserves, and clotted cream.

The dessert course was one of the best I've had, and I think the best among Bay Area tea places. The lemon bar was very good. Their blueberry cheesecake consisted of plain cheesecake with a blueberry sauce. I might have preferred a flavor to the cheesecake, but again, quibbling. It was very good. We agreed that the brownie was the best. It was soft and moist.

The husband jokingly noted that the bathrooms in most tea places are unisex. Even though there are usually two bathrooms, the gender ratio at tea houses is so off it makes sense to make them available to both sexes.
