author: Kathleen M.

description:
This is my first afternoon tea in the Bay Area. I got the Sip Classic Tea with egg salad with arugula, smoked salmon & sip cream cheese, scone, and earl grey tea. Everything was only $18. I think that's an amazing price compared to the afternoon teas I had in England. Though there are limited options for sandwiches and desserts, the sandwiches I had were great. I could tell they were made to order with fresh ingredients. I would definitely come again for a lovely afternoon tea. 

The owner was extremely nice and helpful. 

I recommend making reservation because the place is small.
author: Shelley L.

description: This lovely gem is situated near the Golden Gate Park. Here you can enjoy a quaint tea service with cozy charm. The masala chai was delightful and the scones were fresh with the typical English accoutrements of lemon curd, Devon style cream,and strawberry Cornwall jam. I appreciated this tea room for its unedited version of an English tea in the Bay Area. The prices were also quite a bit more reasonable than South Bay tea salons.
author: JoAnn Y.

description:
I've been dying to try an afternoon tea service for a while now. My boyfriend and I went to stow lake boathouse on a sunny Sunday afternoon. We passed by Sip tea room on our way to the boathouse parking lot. I knew I had to try it since sip teahouse was super close to the boat house. 

Upon entering, there is a sign in sheet in the front. I highly recommend you set up a reservation. The location has only few tables, so you could be waiting a while. I waited a good 20 minutes for 2 people without a reservation. 

Tea for two, traditional English afternoon tea 
Since it was my first time ever trying a tea service, I wanted to try the 3 tier food platters. The amount of finger foods sip tea gives you is very filling. On the bottom tier, we got 3 types of sandwiches: egg salad (try this!), ham, and salmon with cream cheese. The ham sandwich was very heavy on the mustard, not appealing to my tastebuds. The coleslaw that came with the sandwiches was very delicious, probably one of the best coleslaws ive ever tried. 
On the 2nd tier, there was 2 warm scones with whipped cream, strawberry purée, and lemon curd. I recommend eating the warm scone first before anything before it gets cold. The scone wasn't dry at all, which can be a problem with scones. 
On the top tier, there was a small fruit assortment, two fudge bars with walnut crust, cheesecake topped with blueberry, and almond bars. The cheesecake was very tart, not my favorite. I loved how fudgy and chocolatey the fudge bars were. The almond bars were chewy and not too sweet. 
I got the English breakfast tea with my tea service. You get a whole pot full. I ended up finishing my tea pot half way through, and I wish my waitress came back to check up on us so I could ask her if she can refill my pot with water. It was pretty busy, so I get why she couldn't check up on us. 

Sip tea room is beautifully decorated. A modern twist on a dainty tea party vibe. Love the small chandeliers hanging from the ceiling.
author: AJ C.

description: Charming place with very feminine decors and kind waiter! I can understand the 1:45 hour limit per seating but how can the girls only talk for less than 2 hours! :-)
author: SJ L.

description:
Such a pleasant neighborhood find. Charming setting, great service and terrific tea and food. 

The Branston pickle, cheddar and green apple sandwich is a standout in our one visit thus far, but I look forward to having it one-upped by other things in future visits.

The only problem is now whenever we are thinking about making tea at home, we are faced with the dilemma of preferring to walk over and enjoy SIP instead. I guess there are worse things.
author: John V.

description: Sip, sip, HOORAY! We had a terrific tea time today. We were a walk in party of 4, advised to make a reservation for 1.5 hours later. We walked to the car and boom, got the call that a table was open for us, an hour before the reservation. Win! We ordered Tea for Two and an order Saisiage Roll Bites. Yum!!! Tea is tea, but tea with excellent food and a pristine environment is even better. We ordered Yorkshire Golden tea is it did not disappoint. All of the sandwiches, scones and desserts were fresh and delectable. The Branston pickles, British cheddar and green apple sandwich was my favorite. I purchased a jar of Branston pickles to re-crest this sandwich at home. Patrons could do a better job of speaking in quiet voices. Oh, I love that there is a stool at the counter so that a party of one can enjoy a place suited for one.
author: Carla W.

description:
Decent place for tea time!

I appreciate the $18 option of tea that includes 2 sandwiches, 1 scone, and a small pot of tea - because most (if not all) tea services START $25 which includes the same thing except with the addition of a platter of sweets.. which I usually end up never getting into.

Service was friendly and attentive.  I came at 3:00 PM on a Sunday, so it wasn't too busy when I came, though there was just a small wait to have the tables cleared out. The tables are spaced out pretty well where you don't feel like your personal area is being invaded, and overall, it's a very chill place to catch up with a girl friend or two.

The place is on the smaller side, maybe 10 tables max.. Decorations aren't ALL OUT like Dartealing or Lovejoy, and the ambiance is more slow, reserved and quiet.

The food and tea was OK - no complaints but also nothing that stood out in particular. A good option for tea especially if you live near the area. More convenient than all the other places in the city!
author: Emily C.

description: This is a really nice neighborhood Tea place for friends gathering. Workers are extremely friendly! The place maybe too small to accommodate a big group. We ordered tea for two. The sandwiches are tasty but the scones are bit dry! Cheesecake and chocolate mousse are yum! Also tried the soup and salad....soup is tasty but bit on the salty side (Cream of Cauliflower) & salad is just arugula. Could add some color to it with slices grape tomatoes.
author: Jaylene L.

description:
4 stars for the food and service. 4.5 stars for the decor.

Planned this high tea for a month now and FINALLY got the chance to do it last Saturday. My friend and I were very excited and pleased with how cute and pretty everything looked.

I do recommend that you make a reservation if you plan to come here on a Saturday since they can get busy on weekends according to the staff. We made a reservation for 11:00 am and all seats were filled by reservations when the shop opened. 

We had the Tea for Two ($51), which comes with our choice of 
- Large pot of tea, scone of our choice (one/person), four tea sandwiches, coleslaw, Sip clotted cream, strawberry preserves, assorted sweets for two (one of each variety/person)

HONEYBUSH TEA (5 stars) // This wonderful tea had a beautiful sunset orange color and its aroma was just as described: like peaches and honey. The waitress offered us a bottle of honey to add into the tea, and the honey enhanced the taste of the tea so that it actually matches the aroma. We fell in love with this tea. The tea pot, cups, and strainer were also very pretty to look at.

TRADITIONAL CURRANT SCONE (3 stars) // I found my scone dry and unexciting even when paired with the yummy, tart lemon curd. The clotted cream tasted similar to unsalted butter. The strawberry preserves were nothing special.

TEA SANDWICHES (choice of 4 sandwiches, 3 sandwiches/choice)
       (3 stars for the fluffy, white[?] bread that looked a bit gray)
1) Branston Pickle, Aged White Cheddar & Green Apple (5 stars) // This was our only vegetarian choice and we ended up loving it. The branston pickle chutney was so savory and yummy, and was a great contrast to the strong aged cheddar and light apple slices. 
2) Baked Ham, English Mustard & Tarragon Butter (3 stars) // This was definitely one of our least favorite, it can be described simply as ham between two slices of bread. 
3) Smoked Salmon & Sip Cream Cheese (3.5 stars) // I generally love smoked salmon sandwiches, this one was okay. A little more creativity would've made a big difference. I also think if the smoked salmon was kept cold right before serving, it would taste better as well. 
4) Sip's Curried Chicken (4 stars) // This sandwich definitely had the strongest flavor. It was a yellow curry chicken sandwich with raisins mixed into the spread, the sweetness from the raisins was just what I needed to cut the heaviness of the curry.

COLESLAW (4.5 stars) // Nice touch with the addition of apple bits! A little saltier than the average coleslaw with a touch of black pepper.

ASSORTED SWEETS (variety of 3 pre-picked sweets of the day/person)
1) Berry New York Cheesecake (4 stars) // This was my favorite. The cheesecake is surprisingly not as firm as I had expected but overall very yummy.
2) Chocolate Indulgence (3 stars) // This is just a personal rating because this was VERY rich chocolate. Maybe this is for you if you like chocolate as much as Chocolate Boy from Hey Arnold.
3) Finger Shortbread (2 stars) // Dry shortbread topped with almond slices. 

Overall pretty pleased with our experience here, definitely recommend to anyone looking for a decently priced high tea experience.
author: Amy T.

description:
I got to finally try, Sip, a friend of mines new tea shop, which she co owns with someone who is actually British. Since i love tea, particularly, high tea, i decided to take a friend of mine here (whom btw is due to give birth at anytime now!)

I got there early and was immediately seated. Service was excellent and friendly throughout! I decided to go with the high tea while my friend the smaller tea. The high tea comes with two sandwich  choices, coleslaw, a fresh scone that was delicious and assorted sweets and fruit. I really enjoyed the sweets the most, absolutely delicious lemon bars! I had a pot of the Assam tea with cream and sugar and as stuffed as i was, i decided to try their sausage rolls, which were also very delicious, even though i couldn't finish. 

The decor is light and bright and not over eccentric or cluttered. Prices are comparable to other "well known" tea places but without requiring any reservations. Sip, is a solid and authentic afternoon tea experience and great for a girls day out, bridal shower or as i do, just sometimes having a craving and not caring if i'm "sipping" alone.
author: Petra S.

description: I came here to celebrate a friend's birthday and I loved it! They have limited reservations in 2 hour blocks at 11am, 1pm, and 3pm. I would definitely recommend making reservations since it is a small place. We ordered the afternoon tea for two, which comes with 4 sandwiches, 2 scones with lemon curd, cream, and strawberry jam, and assorted small deserts. At $51, it is far more affordable than other high teas in the area, and the food is delicious. Everything is made in house, and you can smell the scones baking as you walk in. There's also a delicious assortment of teas and they will refill your hot water for you. We both felt so full afterwards, so there is a good amount of food. It's super cute, relaxing, and homey, and I can't wait to come back.
author: Hali M.

description:
I haven't written a review in a long while. Today warrants an excellent review.

A friend and I both love high tea, and traveling to different tea rooms throughout the Bay Area and beyond. Today we decided to try Sip Tea Room, and I'm so glad that we did. Out of all the High Teas that I have been to, "Sip" has made it to the top of my list.

The atmosphere is clean, open and simple, but still elegant with chandeliers, china and lace tablecloths. There are subtle hints of the U.K. throughout the room. Not overly done, and not crowded with knick knacks, hats and feather boas (which I always felt to be rather creepy, sharing those items with people that have already worn them for who knows how many times). Room to sit comfortably without being crammed against other tables, or in some places...sofas, and sale items.

The menu is not inundated with a bizillion tea choices, but the teas available should appeal to a wide range of people. The smell of freshly baked scones fils the air, making tea time even more inviting. Fresh sandwiches were all very good and on super soft bread, the sweet treats were incredible, particularly the lemon bar, and the coleslaw was very tasty. The fresh fruit included with the sweeties had PINEAPPLE...my favorite!

Service was excellent. Our wait person was as wonderful as the place itself, and we got to meet one of the owners, Paula, who gave us a little background history on "Sip". Both Paula, and her wait person are British, which to me, makes it all the more authentic and fun.

Another nice "rule" is that children are asked to remain seated. Too often I have gone to places where there are "free range chickens" who are disturbing to other patrons. Tea should be relaxing!

I could go on and on, but I won't. Others have already covered the bases. 

I can't wait to go back and try some of the other items that were not included with our High Tea.
author: Cynthia S.

description: I took my daughter here for her 12th birthday. Little girls and tea is like little girls and pig tails. Delicious tea, ample selection, fresh sandwiches and homemade condiments is stands out. The quality you can definitely taste and the lovely service makes it worth spending a wee bit more. Though, I must say it is expensive but we are in SF so I would say the price is quite average.
author: SF Cloweee G.

description:
I came here with a girl friend couple of weeks ago on a Saturday.  We had a reservation but still had to wait for about 15min before getting seated.  The annoying part was not the waiting but the fact that for good 5min we just stood there without getting acknowledged at all.  This was a consistent theme throughout our experience.  While the staff is friendly when you do interact with them, flagging them and getting their attention is no easy task.  The tea room is small and they don't scan the room to see if anyone needs them -- they ignore you until you randomly fall into their line of vision.  

The food, on the other hand, was very well done.  Tea sandwiches were just right -- not too much bread, plenty of filling, very tasty.  Pastries accompanying the tea were lovely, not overly sweet.  Tea selection is typical -- nothing exotic or fancy -- but good quality tea.  

To be honest, I'm torn about this place in regards to coming back.  For the tea rooms in this price range, San Francisco doesn't have a single one where service, food, and tea would all be equally good.  :(
author: Inna G.

description:
This tea room is a wonderful replacement of what was there before.
Paula and Shannon are the new owners. Paula, from England, being the woman who makes all the food in the back kitchen and Shannon, the enthusiastic manager. 

What's amazing is both women struck me as being true to themselves and this tea room a dream they had. I immediately liked them because of this atmosphere. 

Of course how can one go wrong with tablespoons of homemade clotted cream? Homemade jams, scones, tea sandwiches, quiche and other yummy savories!! How can one go wrong with sipping tea in vintage cups and saucers? 

Looking forward to their acoustic music that will be coming soon!
author: Dianne N.

description: Came in with a couple girlfriends to catch up and had a LOVELY time. The place is very clean and light, great for parties or initiate gatherings. The food and service were amazing. We opted to add the sausage rolls to our service and definitely don't regret it. Would highly recommend - can't wait to come back! xx
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Made a reservation for Sunday afternoon. It was jam-packed! I arrived a few minutes late, but was seated right away. It took my sister another 20 minutes to find parking and they were very accommodating, allowing me to wait seated.

They don't have many tea options, which was disappointing. I was looking forward to trying some exotic tea flavors I can't normally get at the supermarket. We just had the chai. Nothing special. We also ordered the traditional English tea service for two. We chose two egg salad sandwiches, the ham, and the curried chicken. Ham was standard. Egg salad had a weird flavor to it, so I didn't enjoy it. I'm not typically a fan of curry so I wasn't surprised that I didn't like the curried chicken. It was for my sister. I can't remember if she liked it.

The space is small, but cute. The staff were busy, but accommodating. I don't think I would go back though. The food doesn't warrant a return trip. Sorry.
author: Mallory L.

description:
Sip was fantastic. 

I planned a ladies' afternoon tea and had my numbers up in the air. The staff responded to my online reservation request and were kind to tell me to increase to 6 guests they'd need a card (their website lists all of this so it was no surprise. Kudos to their website's rule section because it was so helpful to properly prepare!). I changed the number once after that and then still showed up missing one guest and they didn't complain! Instead they swiftly removed the (now) extra place setting and had my friends and myself settled down for tea about one minute after they opened the doors. 

I found out later on that this was all 5 friends' first high tea and was so pleased that Sip was their first experience. I've been to my fair share of teas around the world and this was a really pleasant one with good food and good tea. 

They did serve traditional fair, with nothing extraordinarily creative or different, but it's nice to know a traditional staple is out there featuring tea sandwiches, scones with curd, cream, and preserves, and assorted sweets.

The decor wasn't traditional for the less expensive Bay Area teas I've attended, but that was a huge draw for me. I'm not interested in the stuffier, over-the-top lace and trinkets. Sip has just the right amount of elegance with beautiful table clothes and adorable, eclectic pots and dining-wear, but it all goes together very nicely without being claustrophobic. I'd go back for sure! The ladies' loved each second.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I love coming here. This is a great place to have tea and take a little me time or have an in-depth conversation with a friend. If you visit once, you're sure to come again!

Crack the scone open at the middle dent & spread on some clotted cream, strawberry preserves or the delicious lemon curd for a traditional tea time treat.
All of their food is made with love on-site. 

Today they tried a new recipe for the lemon curd and the taste alone evoked the memory of walking through a citrus grove on a warm summer evening. The bright floral notes smelled amazing! I love lemon curd, and all of their iterations have been delicious. 

The atmosphere is laid back, comfortable yet modern, and somehow at the same time traditional. The kind of place you want to be and bring your friends. I know most tea houses are visited only for special occasions, but Sip fits in with the neighborhood's relaxed vibe . You'll definitely want to come back again and again.
author: Nessa C.

description: A great spot for afternoon tea right outside Golden Gate Park and the Botanical Gardens! We got there around 2:15 and were seated as soon as a table was cleared. We got the tea for two, which comes with a big pot of tea and a three tier tray of snacks! You get to choose four different sandwiches and two types of scones, and you get an assortment of desserts. We also ordered a side of sausage rolls, yum! The food was lovely and the tea was very good. All served in a lovely teapot with china tea cups in an adorable little shop. I highly recommend coming here!
author: Erin G.

description:
Stumbled upon it and can't wait to go back!

Ambiance-A....quintessential tea house
Tea - Ceylon fabulous!  -A
The ritual of the way they do the tea service- A
Scones -A+.....did I mention I can't wait to go back?
Finger sandwiches- loved the egg salad, smoked salmon, cucumber.....A

Great place. Takes resv
author: Fitzwilliam D.

description: Found this wonderful gem looking on Yelp. We split the traditional English afternoon tea service and a quiche. Everything was absolutely delicious and well prepared. Our waitress Susy was extremely personable and chatted with us about our upcoming trip to Scotland. We had a beautiful lunch eating and drinking tea here. I would highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Kim V.

description: Best scone I've ever had and the rose black tea was lovely. Went on a weekday with my 9 week old and friends. We look forward to returning. Thank you for the wonderful experience Paula!
author: Sara B.

description:
Sip is a really lovely experience!

They have a nice range of tea packages or a la carte options. 

My friend and I each opted for the Sip Tea Classic ($18) which was a good serving of items: 
1. Choice of 1 Tea Sandwich & 2 Freshly Baked Scones -OR- 2 Tea Sandwiches & 1 Scone (comes w/ clotted cream, strawberry preserves, and lemon curd) 
2. Small Pot of Tea

Definitely a fun spot for a ladies outing. We saw a grandmother and a young granddaughter come in all dressed up for an afternoon of fun, super cute!
author: Rachel R.

description: Great first experience! Would come back again! Staff was friendly and the environment is so cute. BUT a bit pricey.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Excellent service and experience! Definitely will be my go to high tea place from now on.
author: Justine J.

description:
My tea room standards are extremely high. I'm from "back east", which is generally more Anglophile than SF, and I've eaten many a scone in London.  Tea in SF has been a disappointment for me.  Everyone raves about that place in Noe Valley, but I find it to be...let me be polite, and just say, not my style.

So I was thrilled to visit Sip.  Right off, the decor is clean and open; enough lace to set the mood without choking you in dusty doilies.  The menu is pretty standard tea service, with enough options to customize to your tastes. I'm a vegetarian, and found plenty on the menu to choose from. The service is polite, friendly, and relaxed.  I wasn't rushed, and my tea was refilled.

I'm looking forward to going back with my friends!  We have already made reservations.
author: Leigh Ann P.

description: Did a walk-in on Saturday around 11:30 am, and the inside seating was full so we decided to sit outside. While we were pretty lucky and didn't have to wait, it would probably be best to try to make a reservation next time. Service was excellent. They offered us blankets since it was pretty chilly that morning. We ordered the tea for two with one of their non-caffeinated teas. They filled up our pot twice during our visit. The food was presented on a three-tier stand. Our favorite was their home-made scones paired with jam, cream, and lemon curd. Overall, it was a great way to spend the afternoon. Just to note, parking was a bit difficult for us to find on the weekend.
author: Andrea F.

description:
Oh my goodness, what a delightful way to spend an afternoon! I'd come here every Sunday if I could (the scones and clotted cream have zero calories, right?!).

The ambiance is bright, clean, and cheerful. The colorful and mismatched china is just so...happy.

The tea selection is great, and I love that you can get an entire pot to yourself. The food is delicious, too - oh my goodness, I want more of those strawberry preserves and cucumber sandwiches with the crust cut off.

You definitely need to make a reservation by calling ahead - they do weekend seatings at 11, 1, and 3. If people no-show, you can get added to the waitlist, but everyone showed up for our seating.

This was such a fun thing to do, and I'll definitely be back!
author: Audrey A.

description: Last time I had high tea was in England. I had very low expectations of this place but it did not disappoint. Wonderful selection of teas and sandwiches along with yummy scones. They use loose leaf teas which is definitely the preference. Excellent service and not overpriced. I the on Beyonce is very cute and very well thought out and definitely resembles an English tea room. Make reservations and advance as they get well quickly.
author: P S.

description:
This review is long overdue.

Never before in all my experience in San Francisco have I been so pleasantly surprised when a long-standing staple of the neighborhood is replaced with another establishment. I've been to Secret Garden a few times and while I enjoyed their tea as well, I used to think the seating times slightly inflexible and the service a little slow.

The lovely new owners are warm and kind and make you feel like they have been around for years and that they have known you for longer. The Sausage rolls are amazing, as are their scones. Like John W, my husband is also not typically a tea-time person but I, for the majority of my adult life, have been. Sip, however has been an exception. He enjoys the food and the service and we have managed to come in at least once a month and sometimes more.

I love Sip, and the warm and friendly family vibe at this place. I can't wait for them to be open in the evenings and enjoy them for more times of the day.
author: Shimi S.

description: Best tea room in San Francisco! Light, bright and cheery, this is a tea shop for the masses. No doilies or fussy decor, the place feels homey and inviting. Excellent tea selection served in fancy cups and pots, and ALL HOMEMADE scones, quiche, coleslaw, tea sandwiches and pastries. They even make their own clotted cream, jams and lemon curd!! Our party of 6 all raved about the food, the service (owners Paula and Shannon greeted the guests, and the wait staff were excellent), and the ambiance. For groups of 5 or more be sure to make a reservation, as Sip already commands quite a following.  A proper tea room for the West side!!!
author: Cynthia F.

description:
It is hard for me to write this review, 1) i am still not sure what was better, the food or the service and 2) I love this place and don't want it to become so full I don't get to go there, but the staff really deserve praise.

Saturday my friend and I walked in with no reservation and asked if we could have tea.  We were told they were totally booked but I saw I table out front with 1 chair and asked if we could sit there? They brought us an extra chair and we had the best time.  From the tea pots that were so darling I (jokingly) asked my friend if I could slip it in my purse, to the best service I have ever received at an outside table it was just a 100% delight.

I am sorry i cannot name our two amazing servers, the lovely gentleman with the stylish glasses and great tie and the beautiful woman in the polka dotted dress with adorable tea pot earrings, you gave us a PERFECT DAY.  The Quiche was delicious, the tea was divine, the Scones were AMAZING (and the clotted cream was heavenly) and I love that they offer a Ploughman's Lunch.

I am so glad Sip has opened.  I will be going a lot.
author: Amy P.

description: Came here as part of my bachelorette party because I AM A TEA LOVER! It was a small but cute tea spot. Nicely decorated and I loved the designs of all dish ware for the tea. Made you feel like you were royals. all of the tea was delicious and the food as well! The packages are decent priced (tea for 2 for example). Could not complain about anything. Even the service was good! I saw that they have mother days specials as well (I went in May) and would def want to bring my mom here one day! Overall great experience everyone in my party loved it...
author: Corelia E.

description:
I brought my 7 year old niece in for a tea service and was very pleased. All of the food was wonderful and the staff was friendly. 

Most significant was that the children's tea service is only $14 (Lovejoy's and Crumpet & Crown are around $18, and the hotels start around $40!). They also take walk-ins. Both of these factors are a plus if you're taking children for the first time. 

We would definitely go back.
author: Wendolyn A.

description: Love this little spot right outside the Golden gate Park! The curry chicken sandwich is amazing. Totally worth the $.
author: theresa l.

description: The service was excellent and very kind & attentive! I'm from the south and it felt like home to me! I got the goat cheese & herb sandwich and I'll never be able to eat anything as good as this for the rest of my life!!! If you're in the Bay area, go here immediately!! It's precious!
author: Amy W.

description: My friend and I stopped by to try Tea for Two on a weekday. Its a great location and so bright and cheerful. Service was outstanding which bumped my rating up to 5 stars. We could tell that a lot of care was put into this Tea house as everything was made in house, all the dishes matched nicely. Our waiter was genuine and took pride in what he was serving us, I wish I caught his name. One of the owners even checked in on us when we were getting ready to leave which was nice. We would definitely come back and look forward to trying other menu items.
author: Regina G.

description: What a treat having tea at the Sip Tea Room on a Saturday afternoon. Both Paula & Shannon were great hosts. The coleslaw, scone, sandwiches & the cheesecake were out of this world. I picked the delicious rose tea from a great selection of teas and I was not disappointed. Don't be shy, I had afternoon tea all by myself & it was a wonderful experience.
author: Wasiliza L.

description:
What an amazing place! It transports you to a proper English tearoom!
The food, the selections on the menu, the variety of teas, there's something for everyone. Paula and her staff are so friendly and welcoming.
author: Christina L.

description: Lovely upgrade to the previous tea room. Everything is homemade and delicious, and the ladies who run it are welcoming and kind. I look forward to many more visits.
author: C P.

description: Just had the loveliest lunch here with my almost three-year-old daughter. The service was very attentive and the food was delicious. What a nice afternoon treat. I'll definitely be back!
author: Stephanie C.

description: It's been a while to wait this place to reopen. I like the lovely decorations, sweets not too sweet, coleslaw is tasty, scone and strawberry preserves are perfect match.
author: Qing L.

description: Called in on a Saturday afternoon right before easter and they were able to accommodate us last minute, so the bf, little man and I were on our way. We came in and I was a bit disappointed when I asked if they had a nondairy creamer but they said they had ran out of almond milk. Other than that, service was great, quick and food was more than we could eat!!
author: Linda P.

description:
This place is adorable!  My friend and I shared the Tea for Two ($51) and it was more than enough for both of us.  We had the Darjeeling blend which I'd highly recommend--it's a mild, buttery tea, and paired well with all the snacks.  My favorite was the scone with clotted cream and strawberry preserves, and the goat cheese and herb sandwich.

We also shared the sausage roll, which definitely wasn't necessary, but was really tasty, with a flaky crust and brown sauce on the side.

The service was so friendly--it felt like everyone there had a stake in this place and really cared about the service and customers.  Mom and pop feels.
author: Olivia D.

description: What a treat! Sip Tea Room is such a gem. The decor, ambience and service are enough to keep me coming but in addition to that, their food keeps me craving more! So delicious! You can taste the quality as it is made in-house and served with pride. Came with my husband who also (surprisingly) enjoyed himself while he tried all the different scones, jams and explored a wonderful variety of tea options. We also ordered several bite sized desserts and they were made to perfection. Truly a great place to meet girlfriends, treat your family to a unique afternoon out or just to step outside the bustling city and into a quaint English cottage. You'll be welcomed with a smile and a memorable spot of tea!
author: Christina W.

description:
First time here,  make sure you make a reservation if on a Saturday.  They were full house from Noon - 1:30 pm.  The owners and her son runs this cute tea room.

The food was delicious.. sandwiches soft and fresh .. scones were warm and the dessert trio was delicious.  They even had someone playing the piano .. which made the high tea even more relaxing.

I can't wait to bring my sisters.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Wow! Even for having opened only a few weeks prior to my visit, I'm amazed. I scheduled a reservation for my mom's birthday and we had an amazing time. The deserts were delicious, and the tea was amazing. Even better, the staff are all lovely people. Thank you so much for being so accommodating, and I can't wait to come back!
author: Jasper-Mikhael R.

description: Had a wonderful experience at Sips! Every bite is fresh and delicious. Service is excellent, attentive and friendly. The restaurant was nicely decorated with Tea memorabilia and for Halloween! The servers do not rush you as we had a leisure tea for over three hours! Will be back again and again!
author: Debbie G.

description: Very cute and kitschy. The tea snacks are good, and they let you bring champagne for only like $10 corkage fee!
author: kittCAT L.

description: Awesome experience in every way! Sip is in my neighborhood, just a few blocks away, and I've been meaning to stop in. Saturday I finally did with my sister in-law and we had a great time. The owner is amazing. She was able to seat us without reservations (but next time we won't leave it to chance and will definitely call ahead and book). Food was perfection, tea delicious, and attention to detail outstanding. Beautiful atmosphere, knowledgeable staff, and friendly from start to finish. Cannot say enough good things about Sip. Looking forward to my next visit.
author: Naomi Y.

description: Had reservations at 1pm for a friend's birthday celebration with 7 ladies. We were seated immediately and went straight to ordering. We got three "Tea for 2" option so we can have three different teas to try. We tried: earl grey, china rose petal, and sencha. My favorite was the china rose petal - the aroma and the taste. I love the little strainers we tee all given so leaves and petals from the tea doesn't fall in our cups. Our order for the good can with: cranberry orange scones, sandwiches (turkey & cranberry, aged white cheddar, branston pickle & green apple, egg salad and smoked salmon), blueberry cheesecake and other small desserts. I was a big fan of the cranberry orange scones. The strawberry jam paired with he scones were delicious! My friends were a fan of the lemon one. My favorite sandwich would have been the egg salad. The sourness is the pickle one with white cheddar stood out to me too much so it was my least enjoyed one. The crust part of the blueberry desserts were burnt tasting, which made us all not a big fan of the dessert plate. Very cute spot with festive and cute decor, service was amazing and very honest. Would return, but not a huge a fan of high-tea food so would return for a special occasion. Plan to come earlier because parking is not easy around here.
author: Amanda C.

description: Went to Sip Tea Room on a Wednesday afternoon with my mom and sister. It is a cute new spot, our tea, scones, and tea sandwiches were all tasty treats on a dreary rainy day. We arrived at about 4 PM, there was no wait for seating but, I  would recommend getting there a little earlier in the day because they had sold out of two of the three scone options.
author: Jaedra D.

description: I came here for my friend's birthday recently on a Sunday, since this has something she's been wanting to do for a while. I had never really gone to a tea room before, so I didn't really know what to expect. But o... m... g... this has to be one of the cutest tea rooms ever. There were lots of floral decorations and chandeliers, and teeny tiny sandwiches and pastries and desserts served on a three-tiered platter. There were more teas on the menu than I knew what to do with. Luckily, since I was there in a larger group, we were able to order three different types to taste - black Masala Chai tea, and herbal options Big Hibiscus and HoneyBush teas. Besides the atmosphere and food/drink, the server was very friendly and helpful when choosing teas. The only part that was kind of distracting was that there was a photoshoot or something going on that day - since it wasn't expected, it felt a bit intrusive.
author: Bianca C.

description: A pleasant spot for a classic English tea service (as they call it) in the inner land of the setting sun. Maybe not quite up to Lovejoy's standards in terms of scone quality and presentation, but still very good. Desserts are the highlight. I like the fact that the tables aren't too close together. Make reservations on the weekends. Service for three will run you about $100 all in.
author: Nick C.

description:
A lovely Mother & Daughter tea. The food was delicious! The Cole slaw is the best I have ever had- their own recipe: crunchy cabbage, grated carrot, a hint of red onion and horseradish. The secret ingredient is a bit of apple. Scones were perfection- light and filled with currants. Served with clotted cream, strawberry preserves and lemon curd. Everything made on the premises. Nice variety of finger sandwiches: my fav was with white cheddar, thin slice of apple and pickle. Trust me: excellent.
Tea was brewed and promptly brought to the table. Now for the most memorable part: dessert. The chocolate square was like the best fudge I have ever eaten made Chocolate ganache. Cheesecake square was light and rich at the same time. I had to take the shortbread home, there was jut no more room. 
Woman owned and run business. They have hit just the right note. We listened to Christmas music and caught glimpses of "A Wonderful Life" which was being projected on a large screen. Nice touch and not overbearing.
author: Michele F.

description: Today's specials: spinach quiche and butternut squash soup. Both were to die for! Everything is made from scratch, down the the pie crust, what a difference it makes.
author: Heather S.

description:
We recently celebrated a friend's baby shower here (party of 7) and it was such a fun place! We made reservations and had a 2-hour window for our party. We were seated quickly and they were very nice and accommodating for our group, especially when we went over our 2-hour mark and they gave us a gentle reminder rather than kicking us out immediately. 
We ordered 3 of the "tea for two" which came on a 3-tier serving platter for each order. Each tier consisted of a plate of desserts, a plate of scones with clotted cream, lemon curd and strawberry preserves, and a plate of finger sandwiches and salad. The scones were tasty - currant, chocolate chip and cranberry orange. We had a selection of sandwiches - goat cheese and herb, ham and cheese, smoked salmon, egg salad, curried chicken and cucumber. The tea was also very good - Hibicus, Masala Chai, and China Green. They also offered to refill the teas with hot water during our stay. 
Everything was very good and would definitely choose to return in the future. It is a small place and it does tend to fill up quickly. Would recommend making reservations for larger groups.
author: A W.

description:
I decided to check this place out on a whim.

I love tea houses and have been to many throughout the Bay Area, but I didn't know what to expect here since the last time I visited it was the Secret Garden Tea House and I had a negative experience there.

It was nice and quiet for a Wednesday afternoon.  I had a table to myself.  There was a couple to the left, two women on the right and two women at the other corner of the room.  

The hostess brought me water and took my order right away.  She was very helpful in helping me choose sandwiches and scones.

I ordered the tea for one with blueberry and currant scones (got the extra scone) and the curry chicken and cucumber sandwiches.  Everything was delicious!  The strawberry preserves, clotted cream and lemon curd were so fresh.  The chocolate cake and cheesecake were dainty and decadent.  The Honeybush tea was excellent.  Next time, I would prefer no onion in the coleslaw.  

Overall, a wonderful tea experience.  I'm definitely coming back!
author: Michelle D.

description: Really nice English tea place. I went here at about 3pm after checking out botanical gardens. I saw people order 3 tier tea time snacks!! Service was amazing as well. I just had tea with some snacks, but that was really amazing too. Highly recommended.
author: Aditya K.

description: Cute little tea room right across from golden gate park. Amazing service and a wide variety of options on the menu. I think I got a lot of food and tea for the price I paid. I totally recommend this place!
author: Lina O.

description:
My 5 1/2 yr old daughter and I had Thanksgiving week off so I wanted to spend a fun Mommy-Daughter day with her.  I surprised her by taking her to tea at SIP.  She was definitely all smiles, because this was something she's been asking again for some time.  So happy I was able to take her and we had a WONDERFUL TIME.

We got there, and it was great because we were the first guests there when it opened.  The staff greeted us right away.  They were very friendly and pleasant.  Our server came over to our table -- was very friendly and attentive.  She shared what was on the Specials board.  And then quickly took care of my daughter by getting her some hot chocolate.

The menu had lots to choose from.  My lil girl had ( in addition to the hot chocolate), a ham and butter sandwich with some fruit and carrots.  I selected and enjoyed two of their sandwiches:  arugula and egg salad, and the traditional cucumber & cream cheese. I also had their soup & salad:  mixed greens with a bright and tasty lemon vinaigrette and potato & leek soup.  Very yummy!  I also had their Mao Feng Shui green tea along with a warm currant scone that was perfectly paired with clotted cream, lemon curd, and strawberry preserves.

We capped off our afternoon with a lil dessert:  a bite of cheesecake with blueberry compote and their chocolate decadence.  

SIP is a perfect little gem to meet with your gal pals, treat your Mom, or of course, take your lil Girl spend some quality Mommy-Daughter time.

Highly recommended and we'll definitely return soon!

Thanks for a lovely afternoon!
author: Jenn T.

description:
Pretty flavorless and kind of expensive. 

I love tea services and have had a lot of them. I was so excited to have a tea place in the sunset! But this place just doesn't flavor their food. The cucumber sandwiches and the salmon sandwiches are flavorless and don't have enough filling for the thickness of the bread. The jam for the scones isn't sweet enough, and if you get a scone without a tea package you have to pay $1.25 for any jam/clotted cream/lemon curd you want, and then they only give you a tiny scoop! For $1.25 you should get a bigger portion! The slaw doesn't taste good. The dessert bites don't seem very British and most of them don't taste good either. All around a very disappointing meal both times.

Also it's cute inside but it'd be more fun if the tea service cups/teapots at our table matched each other. 

The servers are nice though so I guess I'll give 2 stars instead of 1.
author: J M.

description: I tried this place out on February 22, 2018 as a walk-in (no reservation). I'm so glad this location is still a tea room! I had visited the previous incarnation (Secret Garden) and loved that a tea room was in such close proximity to Golden Gate Park/Arboretum. The service was attentive and quick. I had the traditional afternoon tea service. Everything was good; the tea, sandwiches, mini-salad and sweets. The only thing I wish they had was traditional Petit Fours. I will definitely be coming back again.
author: Shivaun O.

description:
There was a previous tea house here before SIP, it was called the Secret Garden.  It was very run down and really needed serious updating. The tea house closed and is now under new ownership, SIP.  

The new owners have made a tremendous amount of improvement compared to the old tea house.  I give them top kudos for the redecoration and updating.  Sip did a great job!  I think this is why my honest review pains me so.  I would have loved to have given SIP a five star rating.  I'm not sure why this tea house has gotten a 5 star rating?

Surprisingly enough I had reviewed Yelp to see the rating and decided that I would give SIP a try.  I have a childhood friend that I get together with a couple of times a year.  We looked at going to SIP as an adventure.  

The presentation was lovely.  The service was good, too. The first thing my friend asked for was half and half and they said they didn't have anything but milk.  I've never been to a tea house that didn't have half and half or cream.  The finger sandwiches were average nothing extraordinary.  The scones ok but probably the best thing on the platter because of the truly delicious curd, clotted cream and strawberry preserves.  I love sweets but the desserts were not light or delicate but really rich and sugary.  The fruit cup consisted of one cut strawberry, one blueberry and a couple of orange mandarin slices, not nearly enough for two.  The tea was good although I think it could have been a little warmer.

I think one of the biggest hurtles SIP has is to make better food than their predecessor, Secret Garden.  Secret Garden was terribly run down and the service not so great, however, the food was excellent.  

I think this could be a really great place.  Perhaps the owner just needs to dial it in a bit.  I think SIP has great potential.
author: Teri O.

description: What an excellent opportunity to have tea and in an even better atmosphere. Food was beyond great and so much flavor. Teas were warm and fresh. Desserts were so soft and fresh...wow. Highly recommend taking that special someone.
author: Stacy W.

description: The service and food was great. Loved what the new owners did with the place; it is open and bright and the decor is lovely. I appreciate that everything is made in house. I took my daughters and my mom there for afternoon tea. My daughter had the children's tea and my mom and I has the afternoon tea for two. We picked the egg salad, ham, curried chicken and smoked salmon sandwiches and all were good. My favorite of them was the egg salad. The desserts that came with our set were blueberry cheesecake, chocolate indulgence and lemon bars. All very delicious. The scone was very good as well. I wish I could have tried more so will have to come back to try their specials. I'm eyeing their soups and quiches for next time.
author: Kristina H.

description: My goodness -- what a treasure!  My son, mother, and I like to try different places around the city for afternoon tea.  This place is at the top of the list for quality, service, and atmosphere!  The tea is high quality, as are all the baked goods.  This isn't the type of place where it's all atmosphere and show -- they really know their tea.  I felt pampered for the price, too.  Highly recommend!!
author: Laurel P.

description:
My top favorite and not just for tea. All the food is prepared right there and by professionals!
The ambiance is perfect for visiting with friends, and the service top-notch.

Not just a tea and cucumber sandwich menu - delicious and uniquely prepared savory and sweet delights!

Can't wait to return.

Susan
author: Susan D.

description: Just tried Sip and it was tasty with good and friendly service. The ordered the complete tea which is served with three tiered tray. I ordered a smoked salmon sandwich and a curry chicken sandwich accompanied with coleslaw. Everything is made on premises and it shows. Wishing them great success!  Gladys
author: Gladys K.

description:
We decided last minute to enjoy some English tea for my niece's 4th birthday. We ordered the traditional English afternoon tea and a few other items (sausage roll, quiche Lorraine, plough man's lunch and extra dessert). Everything was delicious. The scone was nice and warm which was so good with the devon cream and lemon curd/strawberry preserves. The coleslaw that came with the tea sandwiches was the the best I've ever had. The desserts were all really good but I enjoyed the cheesecake the best.
The service here was amazing, they were very attentive and accommodating. We ordered hot chocolate for my niece and they made it at the perfect temperature so it didn't burn her mouth as she sipped it. They also put it in a tea cup (by request) so she could have that tea drinking experience.
author: Diane N.

description:
I'm one of those yelp users that takes a lot and gives little back. But I feel compelled to write a review on this hidden gem in my neighborhood.  Great price point for afternoon tea on Lincoln, right across the street from Golden Gate Park.  The food is on par with most fancy tea places, with nice ambiance and lovely service.  I thought the scones were fantastic (may be on the dry side for some, but just the way I like mine), and the lemon bar on the sweets platter was very nicely executed.  

Areas for improvement: a wider selection of tea (nothing on the tea menu was particularly exotic or interesting to me), and it'd be great to implement some sort of online reservation system so people don't need to call in during business hours if it's not as convenient.  

Other than that, I'm so excited to have a wonderful tea spot in Inner Sunset!
author: Rob L.

description: Got there just after close today, but the gracious owners let us in for a pot of tea anyway. We had a nice pot of Dargeeling, scones (the last two in the kitchen!) and some lovely desserts. Wonderful location across the street from Golden Gate Park and the botanical garden.
author: maria c.

description: What a perfect little spot, right across the street from Golden Gate Park. Every detail of the place was chosen with love. The tea was spot on, the sausage roll (with BROWN SAUCE!) brought me back to the Isle of Wight, and their baker is just plain DANGEROUS. They have a piano in the corner that promises future music, and I heard a rumor of mild liquid intoxicants being made available in the weeks to come. We will return to this lovely place with friends!
author: Ken P.

description:
I hate having afternoon tea. I'm just not girly like that, I don't understand the appeal of drinking hot tea while eating miniature food on a tiered plate, and sometimes having to dress up and wear a ridiculous hat. 

So I went to Sip Tea Room for a shower with my internal eye roll going nonstop and was pleasantly surprised. It's adorable, the food was good, and the service was spot on. All my "girlier" friends raved about it and said it's one of the best small tea houses they've been to, and we will be back!
author: Anonymous L.

description: This email place is so cute, and the scones are amazing. They have a nice tea selection everyone is really nice. Make reservations because the place gets booked up on weekends.
author: Lyora Z.

description: Delectable, Warm and Happy that I chose this for my Birthday Lunch. Lovely atmosphere and the Christmas Cake was superb. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is that the bread for the sandwiches was dry, other than that everything else was brilliant ~
author: Amadis G.

description: Delicious food.  Fun events.  Friendly staff.  What more could you want?
author: The E.

description:
I've been to my fair share of afternoon teas, and this one was something special.

Every single detail- from the sandwiches to the homemade clotted cream and scones to the desserts- was incredible. We devoured the whole tray within minutes. The tea was delicious. The service was warm. Our only complaint is that it's not open for more hours- we can't wait to go back!
author: Melissa M.

description: What a great time we had at Sip! Such a great group of people. Everyone was so friendly and the service was superb. Such cute decor and a wonderful atmosphere. The food was absolutely delicious! My favorite was the lemon bars! I'll be back soon.
author: Colleen I.

description: Went here with a dear friend for my birthday and was blown away at how delicious the food was. Everything is homemade! Absolutely scrumptious!
author: Hannah G.

description:
Had afternoon tea with my friend here and we had the best experience.
The food was delicious and the service by the waiter was great, he was so attentive. We tried the tea for 2 and the sausage rolls (to die for).
Will definitely be back, highly recommended!
author: Diane M.

description: I came here with my sister last weekend because we are trying to break the habit of always going out to drink alcohol. Sip Tea Room was a welcome change. The food was great and it's quiet enough to have a conversation. The decor is classic tea room and they have a kids' menu: I'll be bringing mine here because they will adore it.
author: D E A.

description: Lovey place, delicious sandwiches and scones, great tea selection. Plus, every detail was so thoughtful and adorable. Wonderful, relaxing atmosphere!
author: Andrea W.

description: Wonderful place to have tea, the decor is elegant and hip. The service impeccable and the food was delicious. I ordered the Ploughman's Plate and it did not disappoint. I was in London recently, browsing the menu this item caught my eye. The flavors of London on my plate and my dainty floral tea cup left me dreaming about my next visit to London. I will definitely be back to Sip with friends and family.
author: Therese K.

description: If you want to escape the sounds and chaos  of everyday life , then step into Sip Tea  Room , " A spa for your tastebuds and soul " . You will experience a day made for a king or queen . Where the  aroma  of home made scones , the warm friendly welcome of the server and owners , the delicate fine china touching your lips as the wonderful selection of tea warms your heart , mind , body , and soul one cup at a time "  awaits you. The fine culinary masterpiece of delicate tea sandwiches , quiche , flaky crust sausage rolls , and the confectioners sweet desserts  are served on a three tier stand of beautiful fine bone china plates with the hint of flower patterns from an English garden . Each member of  your table will be served as if you were the Queen or King of the day .The prices range from $7 .00 to $25.00 and that my friend is well worth the experience you will embrace and  believe me the tranquil feeling , the delicious home style cooking , the smiles and comfort you will receive from the owners and servers , will bring you back to Sip again and again . If you don't believe me ask Paula , Shannon , or Susie , they have seen me at Sip once or  ???????????? Even twice in one day
author: Mary P.

description: i agree with jocelyn k...we've been to secret garden and other tea rooms..but sip is the best ever...simple but yet elegant and traditional ..great assortment of  teas..celebrated my moms eighty-first birthday..someone played piano happy birthday tune...my mom picked out our tea ...me mum had egg salad & cumber ..i had smoked salmon & thinly sliced meat with a great dijon...scones were the best,, & because my wife couldn't get time off..i ordered my tea sandwiches and scones..the sweets..etc. so i could home..i suggest  make reservations..if only two ask for the window seating..i'll go back at least a month...my wife and i born and raised in this neighborhood and a casual stroll through the arboretum  golden gate park..
author: Vince V.

description: Stumbled across this great place!  What a pleasant surprise.  I haven't had high tea since visiting England in 1992!  The chocolate chip scone was our favorite with real clotted cream.  Service was fantastic and as well as the decor.  Thank you for a great experience.
author: Elements Of Light L.

description: The sandwiches are tasty, the scones and clotted cream are divine! This is my new favorite go-to!
author: Janice E.

description: I wandered into Sip on a foggy Saturday afternoon and immediately warmed up with delicious tea and a cozy crowd. Although I hadn't planned on eating, the smell of fresh-baked scones was too tempting. I was so glad I ordered one after slathering on homemade clotted cream, strawberry jam and lemon curd. Now I can't wait to go back for lunch to try more.
author: Wynne B.

description: I love this place. The food is delicious and the decor is adorable. It's right by Golden Gate Park and is very inviting after a stroll through the park. I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back and bring a friend!
author: Erin C.

description: Loved the atmosphere, the smell of freshly baked scones and desserts, the tea, and everything we ate...all fresh and delicious. We will return to this newly opened tea room!
author: Carole A.
